Facts: There are 195 countries in the world today, including 193 United Nations member states and 2 observer states.
India is the largest democracy in the world in terms of population. It is the second most populous country in the world after China.
Nepal is home to Mount Everest, the tallest mountain in the world, standing at 8,848 meters.
The Pyramids of Giza are one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World
Australia is home to the Great Barrier Reef, the largest coral reef system in the world
The Great Wall of China is visible from space on rare occasions. The Great Wall is the longest wall in the world, with a length of 7,600 km.
The Amazon Rainforest is home to the world's largest tropical rainforest, with an area of 7.5 million square kilometers.
The Eiffel Tower is the most visited tourist attraction in the world, with over 3.5 million visitors annually.
Russia is the largest country in the world by area, covering more than 17 million square kilometers.
